Detailed Description

Provides generic methods for TableSite management for any databases.

Definition at line 36 of file TableSiteInterface.php.

Member Function Documentation

TableSiteInterface::FindSitesByName (  $  siteName  ) 
 

Selects the Site-s from table which TableSite::TABLE_COLUMN_NAME looks like $siteName.

Parameters:
$siteName the name of the Site to select. It can contain magic chars like BDD_SEEK_MULTICHARS and BDD_SEEK_ANYCHAR where BDD represent your database type. Please refer to your database documentation.
Returns:
- a Sites object : the Site-s which TableSite::TABLE_COLUMN_NAME looks like $siteName in case of success

- an Errors object in case of error(s) : see BDDConnection::Query

Implemented in MySQLTableSite.

TableSiteInterface::IdSiteExists (  $  idSite  ) 
 

Checks whether the Site of id $idSite exists or not.

Parameters:
$idSite The TableSite::TABLE_COLUMN_IDSITE of the site to be checked.
Returns:
- true if site exists

- false otherwise

Implemented in MySQLTableSite.

TableSiteInterface::InsertSite (  Site $  site  ) 
 

Inserts the given Site $site into the table.

Parameters:
$site The Site to be inserted
Returns:
- NULL if operation was successful

- an Errors object in case of Error-s see BDDConnection::Query

Implemented in MySQLTableSite.

TableSiteInterface::SaveSites (  Sites $  sites  ) 
 

Updates validated items in $sites in function of its idSite. If idSite doesn't exist, item is inserted. If an item of $sites hasn't been validate, it is skipped.

Parameters:
$sites a Sites of items to be updated/inserted
Returns:
- NULL in case of success

- an Errors object in case of error(s) : see BDDConnection::Query

Implemented in MySQLTableSite.

TableSiteInterface::SelectSiteByIdSite (  $  idSite  ) 
 

Selects the Site from table which TableSite::TABLE_COLUMN_IDSITE equals to $idSite.

Parameters:
$idSite the id of the Site to select
Returns:
- the Site which TableSite::TABLE_COLUMN_IDSITE equals to $idSite in case of success

- an Errors object in case of error(s) : see BDDConnection::Query

Implemented in MySQLTableSite.

TableSiteInterface::SelectSites (   ) 
 

Selects all the Site-s from Table.

Returns:
- a list of Group-s in a Sites object in case of success

- an Errors object in case of error(s) : see BDDConnection::Query

Implemented in MySQLTableSite.

TableSiteInterface::UpdateSiteByIdSite (  Site $  updatedSite  ) 
 

Tries to update the given site $updatedSite in function of its property TableSite::TABLE_COLUMN_IDSITE.

Parameters:
$updatedSite The Site to be updated
Returns:
- NULL if operation was successful

- an Errors object in case of Error-s see BDDConnection::Query

Implemented in MySQLTableSite.
